greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (0 <= k <= n) is the number of partitions of (n,k) into a sum of distinct pairs.
comment: By analogy with ordinary partitions into distinct parts (A000009). The empty partition gives T(0,0)=1 by definition. A201376 and A054242 give partitions of pairs into sums of not necessarily distinct pairs.
Parts (i,j) are "positive" in the sense that min {i,j} >= 0 and max {i,j} >0. The empty partition of (0,0) is counted as 1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..80, flattened
Reinhard Zumkeller, Haskell programs for A054225, A054242, A201376, A201377
example: Partitions of (2,1) into distinct positive pairs, T(2,1) = 3:
Partitions of (2,2) into distinct positive pairs, T(2,2) = 5:
xref: T(n,n) = A219554(n). Row sums give: A219557. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 22 2012
